data.title: Tried to fix AppVeyor deployment
data.body:
https://ci.appveyor.com/project/OpenRA/openra/build/1.0.1888 failed to deploy.

The documentation on this is incredibly bad. None of the examples in http://www.appveyor.com/docs/appveyor-yml make use of the name so I also try to avoid that. We have just one file so keep it simple.

data.title: Add support for TS-style random tile variants.
data.body: Adds more cheap polish for our TS and RA2 mods, and fixes the last major unhandled item on #5350.

data.title: Finalize the D2k mod
data.body:
Despite the amount of work so many people put into D2k over the past 6 months, the mod is still a long way from being finished.
I'm opening this to keep track of everything that remains to be done. There are several issues open, containing bits and pieces, and there are things that aren't mentioned in any issue yet.
- **Carryall:**
  - [x] Transport damaged vehicles to the repair pad [#8056]
- **Sandworms:**
  - [x] Implement the thumper infantry [#9771]
  - [x] Polish sandworms [#10385]
    - [x] Move animation (#7289)
    - [x] Audio (#7290)
- **Implement original Dune 2000 balance:**
  - [x] Add structure upgrades and fix prerequisites. (Issue: #3211); [PR: ~~#7597~~, #8114]
  - [x] Rename actors/weapons/effects to match the originals. [#9278, #9283]
  - [x] Import original actor/weapon statistics. [#9340, #9408, #9418, #9453, #9458, #9459]
  - [x] Implement proper projectile for the Sonic tank (#4458), [#9357]
  - [ ] Add the Devastator self-destruct (#4926), [#8997]
  - [ ] Fix support powers to match the original (reference: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dmflM70vtZI):
    - [x] Recreate saboteur and fremen support powers. (#6976), [#9521]
    - [ ] Recreate saboteur stealth behavior (timed cloak). (~~#6976~~, #10083)
    - [x] Implement saboteur suicide demolition. (#10080), [#10092]
    - [ ] Add cluster weapon logic for the Death Hand missile. (#7773)
    - [ ] Implement three passes for the airstrike.
    - [x] Fix ornithopter airstrike prerequisites. [#8114]
    - [x] Remove paratroopers. [#9338]
- **AI:**
  - [ ] Make the AI aware of worms (#7048)
  - [ ] Make the AI aware of and able to use concrete (#5784)
  - [ ] Make the AI aware of and able to use thumpers
  - [x] Make the AI aware of and able to use structure upgrades. [#8114]
  - [ ] Make the AI capable of dealing with the original starport behavior
  - [ ] Make the AI capable of dealing with the original spiceblooms behavior
- **Utility:**
  - [ ] Improve map importer handling of "missing" tiles
  - [ ] Implement at least partial MIS file reading (#4280)
- **Assets:**
  - [x] Add video extraction to installation from CD. [#8119]
  - [x] Systematize assets files in Content directory. [#8119]
- **Starport:** (#7055)
  - [ ] Add support for producing multiple actors. [#7786]
  - [ ] Add support for placing an order for multiple actors.
  - [ ] Make the CHOAM space frigate a Helicopter. [#7786]
  - [ ] Make the CHOAM space frigate come in from the closest map edge cell.
  - [ ] Fluctuating prices according to demand for the unit, with limited market capacity.
- **Other:**
  - [x] Spiceblooms (#4462), [#8987]
  - [x] YAML polish (#7274)
  - [x] Make shroud not transparent (#8981)
  - [ ] Add a power bar to the UI

**Note:** There are several other issues that are not mentioned here because they are either visual or audio polish, or not important features like those mentioned above.

data.title: Debug option for showing cell coordinates
data.body:
Being able to see which cell is which have been useful in a multitude of situations when debugging.
I suppose this will want to use something like the performance text for useability reasons, printing the coordinates of the mouse cursor.
I consider this also a pretty basic requirement for a map editor.

data.title: Remove GlobalFilesystem.OpenWithExts.
data.body: Closes #5272.

data.title: Account for terrain height and slope when calculating order location.
data.body: Units will now move where you tell them to on TS maps that include slopes (i.e. all except our one debug map).  The terrain geometry overlay will now also highlight the mouseover cell to aid in debugging any future problems.

data.title: Made RA tent art tileset-specific again
data.body:
Additionally fixed the desert wall palette in the editor by removing now-redundant `.des` versions of all walls (no visual difference to generic .shp versions, so we're not losing anything).

Minor follow-up of #7741.

data.title: Speed up frozen actor visibility updates.
data.body: Cache the isVisibleTest function in the ctor for FrozenActor. The footprint never changes so the test will always be valid.

data.title: Fix a mistake in Map.CellContaining.
Sniper electrocution death anim broken
data.body:
Due to a missing Length definition (and too low Tick value), it doesn't show ingame.

A fix will be included in #7741.

data.title: Disable legacy sequence parsing in RA.
data.body: Like #7738, but for RA.  Only two more PRs after this one!

data.title: Game crashes
data.body:
I'm using Gnome ubuntu 14.04.2 64
After about 5 min the game crashes :-(

This is what the log says:

data.title: Apply character limit to player names
data.body: When player name is read from settings.yaml, there is no length limit. There is a limit in the game settings menu and the lobby but that limit doesn't apply to settings.yaml.

data.title: Disable legacy sequence parsing in TD.
data.body:
This adds new sequence parser support for tileset-specific filename resolution (the last addition needed for #5272), and disables the legacy filename resolution for TD.

`OpenRA.Utility.exe cnc --check-sequence-sprites` now passes.

This and #7731 are the final prerequisites for TS/RA2 style tileset-specific art.  The next pr after these will add the long-awaited TS snow tileset and artwork.

data.title: Improve support power timer display.
data.body:
Improves support power countdown timer text display on top left of the screen. Fixes #4798. Also see #6282.

This commit will change the following:
1) Player's own countdown timers aren't shown in the text. This is redundant since it is already shown in the icons.
2) Timers are divided into two groups: Allies and Enemies.
3) Each group has a header which can be configured in ingame.yaml under SupportPowerTimer@SUPPORT_POWER_TIMER:.
4) The old Order parameter in ingame.yaml is repurposed to configure which group will be shown on top. Default is EnemiesFirst, I thought enemy timers would be more important. Old Order parameter wasn't working for Ascending value.
5) Player names are also shown in front of timer text. When the timer is zero, only the description text flashes white and not the player name.

Here's what it looks like:
![timer](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/6831126/0582ab3c-d327-11e4-9999-5eaed3efd253.png)

I tested this and seems to work.

data.title: Fix a fatal error in allies05a
data.body: Fixes the error described in #7735.

#7725 Closed (Turns out it's a feature) Some times an e1 ejects from bombing a vehicle

data.title: Lazily generate frozen actor renderables.
data.body:
Previously actors that could be frozen under fog but were currently visible would be rendered by the frozen under fog system constantly in order to keep a copy of the renderables ready to go for the frozen counterpart when the actor became invisible. Instead, we now delay this extra rendering until the actor actually becomes invisible. This eliminates the wasted rendering to generate renderables that were never used.

A great example is the RA shellmap, which previously spent 7.0% of the total CPU time generating these renderables just in case. Since the viewer can never see a frozen actor on the shellmap, this was all wasted. With this PR, it now spends 0% of its time doing this.

data.title: Disable legacy sequence parsing in D2K.
data.body: This disables the magic sprite filename resolution (#5272) for D2K and removes the unused parachute sequence definition.  `OpenRA.Utility.exe d2k --check-sequence-sprites` now passes for D2K.

data.title: Clean up sequence key loading and add Reverses field for TS/RA2.
Fix TS/RA2 tileset importer and apply correctness fixes to TS temperate.
data.body: Extends #7707 to TS, and updates the tileset importer to use the correct terrain types and yaml keys.

data.title: Laser beam start/end point "facing" extremely coarse-grained
data.body: Basically, the effect seems to know only four 'facings' (up, down, left, right), at least for the start and end of the line. Becomes very noticable with wider beams, see TS sonic tank for example.
